bug.author: will-sloan
bug.summary: terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::out_of_range' when calling blueprint_library
bug.description:
I am running tutorial.py and the for loop at the end, which spawns 10 cars, causes the blueprint_library to sometimes throw the error: <denchmark-code>terminate called after throwing an instance of 'std::out_of_range' what(): _Map_base::at </denchmark-code>
it doesn't happen every time which is strange. There are some warnings at the start which may be relevant: <denchmark-code>WARNING: Version mismatch detected: You are trying to connect to a simulator that might be incompatible with this API WARNING: Client API version = 0.9.10.1-30-g31fff28b WARNING: Simulator API version = 0.9.10.1-30-g31fff28b-dirty </denchmark-code>
I saw another issue with a similar problem but it was with the traffic manager. Operating System: Ubuntu 18.04 LTS I followed the guide last week to build carla, so it should be the latest version. Also, is there a way to catch this error in python so that the finally clause runs to clean everything up?

comments.comment: Hi, Thanks for pointing this out, we will be looking into this issue and solve it!
